title: Current Topics in Herbal Medicine
content:
Ellen Kamhi, PhD, RN, www.naturalnurse.com, interviews Ric Scalzo, one of North America’s most  respected herbalists... <!--more--> and botanical researchers, with more than 25 years of clinical and practical experience with herbal medicines.
  After studying herbal medicine at the School of Natural Healing under Dr John Christopher, Ric practiced as a clinical herbalist in New England.
He regularly teaches herbal classes, interfaces with the media, and lectures nationally on herbal topics.
Ric Scalzo is the co-author of Herbal Solutions for Healthy Living, a groundbreaking herbal repertory and therapeutic dispensatory guide to the safe and effective use of medicinal herbs that has sold more than a quarter of a million copies.
He also co-authored Traditional Medicines from the Earth, a compendium of formulations that are effective herbal solutions for healthy living, and is the publisher and contributing author of the Protocol Journal of Botanical Medicine.
In addition, Ric is a lifelong student of Vedic philosophy and spiritual practices.
Ric Scalzo holds an honorary Doctorate in Naturopathy from the Southwest College of Naturopathic Medicine in Tempe, Arizona, and received a Master Herbalist degree in 1982 from the School of Natural Healing.
Ric also founded Gaia Herbal Research Institute, which, along with its publishing arm Herbal Research Publications, has contributed extensively to the quality and proliferation of herbal literacy in the United States.
Contact:  http://gaiaherbs.com
